Upon his observation, Tucson suddenly realizes that perhaps it was best to =
take on his beast mode which would provide his body a bit more protection i=
f it were needed.  And so he goes from two legs back to four as he returns =
to his draconic form.  His tail whips around at the tip as it kicks up grou=
nd debris in it's wake.  With no fire breath to speak of he decides to rumb=
le a low pitched sonar pulse to see if he gets a response from it.  His jaw=
s are kept slightly open as rows of diamond sharp teeth and saber like fang=
s become somewhat exposed as what little light if any, glimmers off his lon=
g front fangs.  

There was a definite look of authority in his expression,=
 as it was in the nature of the dragon to be a highly territorial creature.=
  In his spark, he could sense the old dragon's soul, and can understand th=
at he at one time, must have done his best to keep ecological harmony in th=
e jungle.  Due to his failing health he was unable to maintain his authorit=
y, and so chaos seemed to take the place of whatever balance the old dragon=
 maintained.  But that would change.  The soul of the dragon is now Tucson'=
s to keep.  So now he had another commitment to keep, he had to promise to =
keep the harmony and rid the jungle of chaos, as was the dragon's personal =
vow years ago.  That vow was now Tucson's.  So with a heavy thrust of his l=
eft front limb, he firmly puts his taloned foot down and gives a territoria=
l roar.  Come what may he was going to rescue his comrades and win back wha=
t was stolen from Old Earth. There was no mistake, the Silver Dragon had re=
turned to claim his place as the Jungle Guardian.

Perpetually on the move =
and constantly busy. 

On Aug 31, 2011, at 7:48 AM, Super Cyclonus <supercy=
clonus@...> wrote:

> > <OLD>
> >
> > Tucson follows the scent of lub=
ricant and tries to quicken his pace.
> > Something was bleeding and defini=
tely in need of his help. He looks on the
> > ground, trees, foliage, and g=
rass to see if a trail is left to follow. And
> > then the electrical smell=
 of something being shorted out, reaches his scent
> > receptors and he's q=
uick to follow the scent.
> >
> > " Whoever you are, stay put, I'm conning =
to help you!"
> 
> <NEW>
> 
> As Tuscon bursts through the foliage and brus=
h to 'rescue' the
> vicitim, he can see the fallen form of something! As he=
 approached he
> could see that it was a sweep, the last bit of lubricant l=
eaking from
> a rather large gash in its chest plating. There does not seem=
 to be
> any life left in the sweep. If it was what was making the noises f=
rom
> before it is no longer doing it now, there are no life signatures
> c=
omming from it.
> 
> All around TUSCON the sounds of the forest have gone s=
ilent.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> - Preston
> 

--Apple-Mail-75--664525670

<html><body bgcolor=3D"#FFFFFF"><div>Upon his observation, Tucson suddenly =
realizes that perhaps it was best to take on his beast mode which would pro=
vide his body a bit more protection if it were needed.  And so he goes=
 from two legs back to four as he returns to his draconic form.  His t=
ail whips around at the tip as it kicks up ground debris in it's wake. &nbs=
p;With no fire breath to speak of he decides to rumble a low pitched sonar =
pulse to see if he gets a response from it.  His jaws are kept slightl=
y open as rows of diamond sharp teeth and saber like fangs become somewhat =
exposed as what little light if any, glimmers off his long front fangs. &nb=
sp;</div><div><br></div><div>There was a definite look of authority in his =
expression, as it was in the nature of the dragon to be a highly territoria=
l creature.  In his spark, he could sense the old dragon's soul, and c=
an understand that he at one time, must have done his best to keep ecologic=
al harmony in the jungle.  Due to his failing health he was unable to =
maintain his authority, and so chaos seemed to take the place of whatever b=
alance the old dragon maintained.  But that would change.  The so=
ul of the dragon is now Tucson's to keep.  So now he had another commi=
tment to keep, he had to promise to keep the harmony and rid the jungle of =
chaos, as was the dragon's personal vow years ago.  That vow was now T=
ucson's.  So with a heavy thrust of his left front limb, he firmly put=
s his taloned foot down and gives a territorial roar.  Come what may h=
e was going to rescue his comrades and win back what was stolen from Old Ea=
rth. There was no mistake, the Silver Dragon had returned to claim his plac=
e as the Jungle Guardian.<br><br>Perpetually on the move and constantly bus=

definitely in need of his help.  He looks on the<br>

oliage, and grass to see if a trail is left to follow.  And<br>

he electrical smell of something being shorted out, reaches his scent<br>

gt; receptors and he's quick to follow the scent.<br>

er you are, stay put, I'm conning to help you!"<br>

<NEW><br>
<b=
r>
As Tuscon bursts through the foliage and brush to 'rescue' the<br>
vicit=
im, he can see the fallen form of something! As he approached he<br>
could =
see that it was a sweep, the last bit of lubricant leaking from<br>
a rathe=
r large gash in its chest plating. There does not seem to be<br>
any life l=
eft in the sweep. If it was what was making the noises from<br>
before it i=
s no longer doing it now, there are no life signatures<br>
comming from it.=
<br>
<br>
All around TUSCON the sounds of the forest have gone silent.<br>
